page.title: 02EDUCATION IN MOUNTAIN ASH
page.content: {There are 9 primary schools}in Mountain Ash(one of which is a Catholic school),all of which are'feeder'schools to the one very large split site secondary school in the town. The primary schools are typical examples of late nineteenth,early twentieth century architecture to be found in the South Wales valleys.They generally have tall steep roofs,with stone walls taken from local sandstone quarries. The classrooms are usually situated off a main central hall. They have large windows and very high celings. They are therefore expensive to heat in winter.Unfortunately due to lack of money many schools are in need of urgent repair.
